name: The Midland

reviews.title: Beware of Parking
reviews.text: I thought i'd write a quick warning note to the people who are booking here for the night, before they fly away at manchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After making a booking for £108.00, i phoned ahead to check their rates of parking... it's £15.00 a night offsite, meaning that the total parking fee for two weeks while i'm on holiday would have been £210 + plus the room costs!
reviews.title: Great hotel for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservation Cancelled!
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: Recent sympathetic refurb has done wonders for the old place. The rooms are modern clean and pleasant and overall the hotel feels a cut above the average city identikit places.
reviews.title: Well worth the wait

likes.disliked: — Bedroom layout could have been better - the bed was very close to the door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very pleasant and helpful, room service quick, swimming pool and gym reasonably equipped and clean.
reviews.title: Very Grand and confortable - but beware inclusive dinner rate

likes.liked: — Bedroom lived up to standard of reception area
likes.disliked: — Inclusive dinner rate was only in indifferent carvery restaurant

reviews.text: I stayed at The Midland hotel in Manchster for one night while on business in early June 2013. Booking through my companys account means we are usually allocated a smaller or cheaper room, but my room at The Midland (I think it was 601 or 603?) was massive, with a huge king size bed and seating area. The bathroom was very clean with a nice powerful shower. The only issue I had was that I couldnt find a room service menu anywhere in the room....but thats a minor point.
reviews.title: Grand hotel, huge rooms

reviews.text: The lobby/check-in area of the hotel was very large and grand, and the desk staff were very helpful. A friendly gentleman greeting visitors at the front door help add to the sense of grandeur and old-style class.
reviews.title: Beautiful but a few niggles which could have been avoided.

reviews.text: Despite being located on a busy main road I didnt have any problems with traffic or pedestrian noise, and the excellent free bus (line 3) that runs around the city centre stops very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.text: I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel for either business or leisure visits to Manchester.
reviews.title: Sleek, comfortable and well run

reviews.text: The Midland is a beautiful hotel with first rate facilities and a great city centre location.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Yesterday we had the most fantastic wedding reception at the midland hotel for my daughters wedding. From beginning to end it was perfect. The service was brilliant , all the staff were just so helpful and attentive, the food was delicious. Nina the wedding co-ordinator was great, steering us through plans which can be quite stressful at times. So a big thank you to her. I lost count the number of guests who came up to me and said how wonderful it was. The ceremony was at norcliffe chapel so the contrast with the midland in the city centre was great. So a very big thank you to everyone.
reviews.title: wedding

reviews.text: Excellent staff, excellent service, super helpful everywhere, so difficult to beat! The team for the Wedding Meal and at Breakfast were just fantastic, with all staff so helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Wedding

reviews.text: Great position for a visitor to Manchester, and you only get what you pay for, and at The Midland you certainly are well looked after.
reviews.title: My New Favourite Luxury Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel.
reviews.title: Disapointing

reviews.text: I came here thinking it would be like other "luxury" hotels where the entrance is grand but the rooms are so-so.
reviews.title: Excellent city centre hotel close to rail network

reviews.text: I stayed in the Midland on Saturday night, on the eve of the Man. Utd. v. Liverpool match. The hotel is housed in a magnificent building and the spacious and inviting lobby adds to the sense of grandeur which permeates the place. There were four of us (all football supporters) in two rooms and the room I shared had two exceptionally comfortable double beds which invited sleep. Unlike the previous reviewer, I had no difficulty in sleeping and found the curtains to be highly effective in blocking out the natural light. Not sure about the light shining through the door ; I guess, as in my case, if you have a few drinks the night before a big match, you're not really worried about minuscule cracks of light shining through doors. The room itself was quite large and the bathroom was accessible through a small hallway which separated it from the main part of the bedroom.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel wins on most counts

likes.liked: — The front of house staff are of the highest calibre
likes.disliked: — If the Midland could make more robust coffee, their breakfasts would be perfect.

reviews.text: The people working at the front desk were charming individuals, with the Northern warmth of character typical of many Mancunians. One of our number had joined us from London at the last minute and the housekeeping in the hotel quickly set up an additional bed in one of the rooms for him. Without being asked, they also volunteered to look after our bags for us while we were at the match.
reviews.title: Style over practicality and comfort

likes.liked: — The location, in the centre of Manchester near to everything.

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was of a high quality and I sampled the full English together with their selection of fresh fruits. The only minor note of criticism is that hotels with a large clientele often find it difficult to make coffee which is worthy of the name. The only structure I would fault in the building is the bar. Adjacent to the lobby, it is literally an alcove in a wall and the drinking area is a high-ceilinged circular area which is imbued with a strangely dead atmosphere. Indeed the only life was the sound of 70s music blasting (and I really mean blasting) from a wedding reception whenever anybody opened the door of the function room to head for the bar.
reviews.title: Good, huge hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On balance, however, all four of us really enjoyed our weekend at the Midland. And Manchester United beat Liverpool 2-0 on Sunday afternoon. So, all was well in our particular world as we headed home on Sunday night.
reviews.title: In need of renovation and a better chef!

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights for a wedding party, the rate was meant to be special as most of the party were staying there, but at £115 B&B we might have done better elsewhere. Expensive but worry-free parking around £30 on top.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived at hotel early staff at concierge desk were more than happy to deal with our suitcases while our room was been service so we could hit the sights of Manchester straight away,
reviews.title: excellent stay, best hotel i have ever stayed in

reviews.text: staff were very professional indeed very polite, when we arrived to check in hassle free really room was perfect apart from no iron or board phoned reception to ask if we could have one within 3 minutes there was a knock at the door with an iron & board that's service.
reviews.title: Just Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a meal in the restaurant witch was perfect , the only down side to the break was the breakfast staff were no where near as good as the other staff every time we more to the breakfast buffet the staff would completely clear the table as if we had finish when we had only been there 5 mins but apart from that the hotel and staff were perfect, would visit hotel again
reviews.title: Grand, Slightly Dates Hoted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a special half term deal at the Midland with bed breakfast and evening meal at a very reasonable rate, paying just over £300 for 2 nights for 2 adults and 2 kids.
reviews.title: Return Stay Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our visit was a fantastic experience from start to finish. Every single member of staff we came into contact with made us feel special, even giving special attention to our small daughters which is something you don't get everywhere as not everyone wants to see small kids in their hotel.
reviews.title: Manchester break
Old, large comfortable hotel in good location
reviews.text: Hotel is located right on the plaza, and is best location downtown. Large, old glorious hotel. Rooms were large and bed was comfortable, which is not typical in this area of England.

Starbucks right across the street, and drugstore half block away should you need something. A few nice restaurants nearby, and 3 blocks from Chinatown and one block from Manchester library. Shopping area about three-quarters mile away, as is Picadilly. Tram from train station stops right in front of hotel and is ten minutes from Picadilly station.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Internet service. Staff pleasant and professional. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, so convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably the best hotel in Manchester. My room was upgraded to a large two room suite so I'm a bit biased. I have stayed a couple of times there before and would be surprised if anyone didnt like this hotel.
reviews.title: Good but could be better...

likes.liked: — Chocolates and champagne in the room and the French restaurant!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one night while on a business trip.
reviews.title: Midland mixed blessings

reviews.text: Apart from being in the heart of the nightlife with the inebriated using the outside wall as a place to squat, and the cocaine snorting in the loo, it was ok! Staff were great, very polite and helpful. The cutlery at breakfast was poorly cleaned.
reviews.title: Glad I only stayed the weekend!

reviews.text: I'm giving the Midland the highest score possible, because they are geared towards guest service. I needed an adaptor, it was brought to my room promptly. Once I received the adaptor the Internet would not work, so I called downstairs. I was put on hold for a minute and the rep told me they would be changing my room. In a few minutes after that call, the concierge was at my door with a new room key. Once I changed rooms the Internet worked well. This morning I went down for breakfast, very nice dining hall with fast service. The servers were all very pleasant and helpful. After breakfast I stopped at the front desk to pay my bill. One thing I've noticed, you don't wait very long for anything... They handle all things very quickly. And they also will stop what they are doing, if its not attending to another guest... To honor you needs and request... Way to go Midland. The hotel by itself would not earn the high rating... It is the staff, that has made me rate this hotel high.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and thought that the overall experience was great. Room was spacious and well equipped. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were are really helpful.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Manchester

reviews.text: Location is very good with good transport links.
reviews.title: Dissapointing stay

reviews.text: A friend won a one night stay in a standard room due to her excellent charity work. Fortunatly she was not able to spare the time to take a holiday over the 2 month period that she was given so allowed myself and her son to go instead. Upon arrival we were overwhealmed by the specacular building and lovely man in tophat and tailcoat who opened the door for us. This was where it went downhill for the first day.
reviews.title: Fantastic concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what can i say!! this hotel was amazing!! i booked to stay on saturday night with my boyfriend and from the moment we stepped into the front door it was pure luxury!
reviews.title: WOW! WOW! WOW!!pure luxury!

reviews.text: the lobby where reception was located was fantastic! beautiful and very luxurious.the staff were really friendly and polite and i requested a quiet room and we were given a perfect room on 5th floor facing inwards and were not disturbed at all.
reviews.title: Bring Your Own Marmite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room we had was great, spacious , really clean and had the best tv ever!!..a huge flatscreen tv!
reviews.title: Stunning building but Service suffered when it was busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bathroom was great, light , airy and had a powerful shower and nice toiletries provided.
reviews.title: Very nice.

reviews.text: our stay was totally wonderful and was topped off by the huuuuge english breakfast we certainly enjoyed on sunday morning....had to go back to bed for a lie down!
reviews.title: Old style glamour

likes.disliked: — Needs to sharpen up on service

reviews.text: We would like to thank the "Midland " for the best anniversary we have ever had. We don't like to call it a hotel it's more a glorified chicken farm !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: ALL FUR COAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the following reasons:-
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: 1. The smoke screen that greets you in the foyer.
reviews.title: Badly trained receptionist spoilt my stay

reviews.text: 2. The warmth and hospitality from the incompetent reception staff.
reviews.title: First class customer service

reviews.text: 3. The endless effort to try to accomodate you and your family.
reviews.title: The Midland & octopus travel, where a confirmation means nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: on arrival was pleased by the standard of hotel and the situatuation of room as requested a high floor room and had a good view of the city centre, but regreted that later, (dont have room 623). The noise from the room was terrible the room didnt seem to be properly double glazed and felt that there was a gap somewhere in the windows, 6 floors up and could here every noise including the screeching of tram brakes, a busker who went on playing all night (sleep impossible) could even here people talking below, have stayed in 2 and 3 star hotels and have never had a problem like this before.
reviews.title: middle of manchester

reviews.text: Gym very small, and jacuzzi only fitted four although pool water was a lovley tempreture.
reviews.title: Well located, but needs some love

likes.liked: — Location is great... everything within walking distance
likes.disliked: — Carpets and bedding... need a makeover!

reviews.text: Breakfast was very nice with a good choice, although staff not overly friendly, on reflection wouldnt go to this hotel again not really a 4 star.
reviews.title: Why wont the windows open?

likes.disliked: — locked windows and a silly jusitifcation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed last june for 3 nights at the Midland.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel shame about the customer service

reviews.text: It is very well located with bars, restaurants, shopping and many office towers within walking distance. I was there on a business trip and found the meeting rooms to be very acceptable.
reviews.title: plush but pricey

likes.disliked: — overpriced especially room service, sealed shut windows

reviews.text: The room was very nice and one can see why Mr. Rolls and Mr. Royce chose this venue. It's centrally located and an easy stroll to most things needed (nice restaurant, local pub, etc.). The nightlife outside is pumping nearby (clubs, etc., that open late, late) but the inside is full of the nearly-dead in the brightly lit lobby bar area. Although I enjoy an nightcap, the bright lights were offputting - I'll try the Radisson Edwardian, just a few steps down the road, next time for a more suitable nite bar atmosphere.
reviews.title: Enjoyable - Radisson Edwardian Next Time

likes.liked: — Nice size rooms and very clean and centrally located
likes.disliked: — Night bar was blazing light like the sun at midday in the Sahara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and staff were great and the taxis right out the door made my AM journey over to Picadilly station easy.
reviews.title: .....not worth the cash

likes.disliked: — Price - better hotels are both to the right and left on this one

reviews.text: Thought I'd treat the missus to a 'nicer' hotel for our stay in Manchester and have to say for the money it wasn't worth it. Don't get me wrong , the hotel isn't bad and service etc is all fine but you just feel that to really get the value you have to spend £150+ (room only) to get the nicer rooms. Everything in hotel from the rooms to the pool is small, again maybe I've been lucky to stop in more modern hotels which all seem to have bigger facilities and cheaper prices for example the sauna could only fit 4 people in (not really a problem for me as I'm a sociable guy but for others I'm not too sure) and to get to changing rooms you have to walk through the gym (again I'm not bothered but are the ladies when you literally have to say excuse me to get past)
reviews.title: Chilled out hen weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great and Manchester it self is a wonderful location with lots to do ...if you like Chinese food, head for the Rice Bowl near the Arndale centre for great food, service and price
reviews.title: The hotel where Mr Rolls and Mr Royce met
' fantastic stay '
reviews.text: We booked the Midland through the stag and hen company. The hotel was lovely. We checked in early at 1.30 which was fantastic. We chilled out in the spa it was really lovely, pool was quite small not quite enough room for 4 of us to have a woggle race! I had a manicure and a pedicure which was lovely. We had room service which was very quick! We went out into manchester and got back around 2.30. I really wanted a tuna sandwich even though it wan't on the menu the staff made it! We sat in the lounge and chilled for half an hour it was a perfect end to a great evening. Breakfast was yummy everything you could ever want buffet style. Some of us used spa in monring check out was easy although my sister had moved somethings in the fridge and so been charged until we told them that she had just moved them not drunk it ops!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the Easter weekend. The room we got was tiny and the bed was more like a large single rather than a double! It seems we may have got the smallest room in the place as our friends room was massive compared to our, although it did smell odd - like vomit actually! We were unable to change rooms as the hotel was fully booked due to 3 weddings and the annual teachers convention taking place. As you can imagine the hotel was very busy.
reviews.title: Good Location
Hotel does not honour bookings
reviews.text: The breakfast was just ok, buffet style, all the usual stuff.

The location of the hotel is excellent and the bar/lobby area was lovely. We relaxed there every evening before heading out, drinks are very pricey though! We also had afternoon tea which again was expensive but it was nice to just chill in the lobby bar watching the world go by.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — The bed and the breakfast service

reviews.text: We ate at Gaucho & San Carlo - I highly recommend both, another great place to check out for drinks is Cloud 23, the bar on the 23rd floor of the Hilton.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We have stayed at The Midland Hotel a number of times and have always regarded it as one of the best hotels in Manchester. Our opinion has changed. We booked a night’s bed and breakfast at the hotel for April 9th through HotelsClick. The booking was confirmed on March 3rd and the cost of the stay taken from our bank account. 48 hours before our stay HotelsClick contacted us to inform us that the hotel had overbooked and could not accommodate us. Since this was the evening of the Manchester United v. Roma and the World Swimming Championships I am sure that the hotel could ask more for our room than we had paid! Emails to the hotel were met with curt and unhelpful replies. HotelsClick eventually found us a room at The Macdonald Manchester Hotel where we were very well looked after. I would warn other travellers to beware since bookings not made directly with The Midland Hotel may not be honoured.
reviews.title: Imagine someone blowing over the top of a giant bottle........

description: The Midland hotel in Manchester is an iconic Grade II listed building. The hotel oozes luxury, comfort and style, and enjoys a history that leaves other Manchester hotels out in the cold. The hotel is famous for it's fantastic architecture and the building’s characteristic style continues inside, where you’ll find opulent décor, rich fabrics and shimmering chandeliers. The hotel has 312 spacious, stylish bedrooms to reside in.The Midland is conveniently located in the heart of Manchester city centre. The hotel is ideal for both leisure breaks and a superb venue to hold a conference or event. For leisure guests The Midland is conveniently situated near to theatres, museums and of course the fabulous array of shops in the city centre. If you are here on business you'll be pleased to hear that The Midland have 14 conference and meeting rooms which can hold up to 700 people. The Midland also offer free internet access to all guests and delegates. After a busy day of shopping or stressful day in the meeting room, enjoy relaxing in the leisure club which is home to a gym, swimming pool and squash court. As for your dining experience, well you can choose from a number of different options including the AA rosette award winning French Restaurant, voted one of the top restaurants in Manchester and our newest addition; Mr. Cooper's house & Garden, both overseen by two Michelin Star chef Simon Rogan
